intro: Cyathea pholidota, commonly known as the broad-leaf tree fern, is a tropical evergreen plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk covered in persistent, fibrous roots. The plant features large, pinnately compound fronds that can grow up to several meters in length. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Cyathea pholidota plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and contributing to forest biodiversity.
